Constructor Detail

FMinterface

public FMinterface()
Method Detail

radioIsSupported

public boolean radioIsSupported()
To verify if there is an FM-RDS radio chip on the device that is supported by this library.

Returns:
true, if there is a supported FM hardware, false if not

openRadio

public boolean openRadio(AudioManager audioManager)
Power up and enables the FM radio chip.

Returns:
true if successful, false if error

closeRadio

public boolean closeRadio(AudioManager audioManager)
Power down and disables the FM radio chip.

Returns:
true if successful, false if error

setBand

public boolean setBand(int band)
Sets the band of the FM receiver.

Parameters:
band - Can be either BAND_87500_108000_kHz, BAND_76000_108000_kHz or BAND_76000_90000_kHz.
Returns:
true if successful, false if error

setSpacing

public boolean setSpacing(int spacing)
Sets the channel spacing in the FM receiver.

Parameters:
spacing - Can be CHAN_SPACING_50_kHz, CHAN_SPACING_100_kHz or CHAN_SPACING_200_kHz.
Returns:
true if successful, false if error

setEmphasis

public boolean setEmphasis(int emphasis)
Sets the de-emphasis time constant in the FM receiver.

Parameters:
emphasis - Can be either DE_TIME_CONSTANT_50 or DE_TIME_CONSTANT_75.
Returns:
true if successful, false if error

setChannel

public boolean setChannel(int frequency)
Tune the FM receiver to a specific channel (frequency).

Parameters:
frequency - In kHz (ex.: 106.3 --> 106300, 99.1 --> 99100)
Returns:
true if successful, false if error

seekChannel

public int seekChannel(int direction)
Seek the available frequencies within the range specified in setBand().

Parameters:
direction - Seek up:1 Seek down:-1
Returns:
frequency the frequency (in kHz) found after the seek if successful, otherwise returns 0

setVolume

public boolean setVolume(int volume)
Sets the volume on the FM receiver directly. Note: The volume on the FM receiver is not the same volume then the one selected by the user with the volume button. It is necessary to update the volume on the FM chip with the volume selected by the user to enable the user to control the volume. If that is your goal, use instead syncMediaVolume(AudioManager).

Parameters:
volume - Between 0 and 15
Returns:
true if successful, false if error

getPI

public int getPI()
Returns the Program Identification (PI) of the current channel.

Returns:
PI if received, otherwise returns 0

getPS

public java.lang.String getPS()
Returns the Programme Service (PS) of the current channel, once it is received completely, i.e the 8 characters have been received.

Returns:
PS if received, otherwise NULL

getRT

public java.lang.String getRT()
Returns the Radio Text (RT) of the current channel, once it is received completely, otherwise returns null.

Returns:
RT if received, otherwise returns a empty string.

syncMediaVolume

public void syncMediaVolume(AudioManager audioManager)
Synchronises the Android Media Volume (controllable with the volume button of the phone) with the FM chip volume. When calling this function, the FM receiver volume is updated to the Media Volume value.

Parameters:
audioManager - In your application, use Context.getSystemService(Context.AUDIO_SERVICE) to get an instance of this class.

processRDS

public void processRDS()
Retrieves and decodes the RDS coming from the RM receiver. This function should be called periodically. To access the decoded RDS, use getPI(), getPS() and getRT().

decodeRDS

public void decodeRDS(byte[] rawRDSgroup)
Decodes the given raw RDS so that the PI, PS and RT becomes available.

Parameters:
rawRDSgroup - An RDS group, of 8 bytes. 1 group = 4 blocks of 16 bits = 8 bytes. So rawRDSgroup[0] = Block 1 LSB, rawRDSgroup[1] = Block 1 MSB, rawRDSgroup[2] = Block 2 LSB, etc...
